Posted: October 3, 2016
Early Access Review
								(should a bug be fixed ill remove it) (maybe this will slowly become more updated where It could be a thumbs up sometime. id say the bad still outweighs the good currently)Game was updated removed some. Clipping through trees then being flung - Happened twice when a tree fell NEXT to me it catipulted me a good distance enough to kill meBuilding in workbench freezes up - Cant build anything out of a workbench even when all supplied materials are in its invintory can only destroy the bench and make a new one or spam click till it does what it should. Modders - From what it looks like this game has released absolutely nothing in terms of mod API, a good quarter of the time SE updates come from modders i notice. Here the most success ive seen in workshop is when people can create a functioning door with the tools they are given. Physics Beyond hilarious and its just not worth going in detail. A rope and torsion gate snaps and swings erratically breaking all common sense of physics it moves on its own. Structural integrity  Placing a block 3 blocks away makes something else collapse. 3 blocks away a battlement staircase crumbles because I put a block 3 blocks away from it. Structurally It does not make sense things placed very far away affect things it shouldnt. (easier to see than explain)

content:
Posted: March 15
Early Access Review
								Pros:-...idk i just used refund...(maybe physics)Cons:-(i will skip bugs since it is in early access)-Even if you have the best system and run it on max settings graphics don't look like they are at videos/photos, structures aren't actually real/solid... anyone can see that they are "combined papers".-as i mentioned above even with the best system you have big perfomance issues (and those graphics don't worth it   seriously)-the worst UI a game can have (even a garbage has better UI nowdays)-the map is actually like a browser online game and the landscape is the same everywhere without any signs of water or  some sort of desert or snow ( ok desert/snow maybe isn't so necessary but i wonder how they call this "MEDIEVAL" without water, and I know that water is hard to program but if you can't manage water then you shouldn't even release such title ) and the trees are all the same without details etc. Though the description says there is an entire planet to explore...?-the AI is crap, only some bandits and some wild life that don't function well (e.g. deer realises it must run away from you  when you have reached it...). When you build anything then it is empty without any sign of life except of you... and there  is no reason to build anything for defense since there is nothing to attack you except of a player with a siege engine and  that's all of the combat... you "trade" boulders... (if you play multiplayer).-multiplayer is empty, only 1-3 low pop servers-no armor/weapons ( only a poorly designed crossbow for hunting and your tools )-as for the building system seems nice to handle but since this is a game that focuses on medieval engineering it should  have rich variety of tier structures... e.g. there is only stone and wood structures... where is limestone/adobe and much more that should be in-game ? even other survival games have richer variety and they are not based on physics/building  so much.-ok some of the above would be tolerable if the game had launched this week but it is out for 2+ years!-And generally any other con you will see in other reviews.Definitely doesn't worth 19-23 bucks, it was just an easy cash crab product that has no future. (To understand how little content this game offers his downloadable size is 1,9GB... a 2015-2017 3D game full of heavy physics...)

number of helpful: 2 of 11 people (18%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 26, 2015
Early Access Review
								I absolutely love this game to pieces, the environment is so beautiful and the textures are fantastically modelled, this game shows great promise already with siege warfare mechanics and its dynamic building which already has a broad range of options. The destruction is wonderful, it looks so real it scares you, the way walls crumble, roofs cave in and buildings implode. However its still in a early build and there are many small but vital mechanics missing, such as the ability to remove rubble and debris which can pile up and become a nuisance, the game tends to crash while loading maps and destruction of buildings cause serious lag even to the best of computers. This game is great already, but I would wait just a year for it to be fully developed and playable. ;)

Early Access Review
								Everything you build collapses under its own weight. The building mechanincs are annoying and hardly manageable. It is difficult (not impossible) to get pieces to place the way you want, where you want, or how you want. They kinda have a mind of their own. The absolute worst medieval sandbox game I've played and its supper dissappointing because it looked like the sandbox I've been wanting. I wish the structures did not collapse and I wish there was programmable AI, like blacksmiths. clerks, etc. I guess I'm going to have to keep waiting for a game like that. First person sandboxes like this seem fun and I want a good one, but this one is just irriating and tedious.

content:
Posted: February 20, 2015
Early Access Review
								As of right now, I do not recommend this game unless you are a hardcore architecture nerd. Even those feeling the itch to live out their own medieval fetishes should stay away until this is more developed. For what it is (a tech demo with limited "game" functionality) this beast looks promising; alas, there is little to do beyond build at the moment.+Game engine is pretty.+Block placement improved upon since Space Engineers.+Peaceful atmosphere with many block options.+Terraforming is implemented.+Knocking down castles is satisfying.-Physics are wonky.-No animals.-Limited decorative items.-NO MULTIPLAYER YET.-No farming.-No weapons beyond siege equipment.-No survival aspects yet.-The heat coming off of your GPU will relieve the neighborhood of snow.

content:
Posted: February 23, 2015
Early Access Review
								Medieval Engineers: Ancient Ruin Simulator.The game is pretty basic right now. You can build some castles, some bridges, a few mechanisms. You can then break them with stone balls.Pretty good, but the the physics engine is so broken, you'll be building something and then suddenly for no reason on the OTHER SIDE OF THE BUILDING, something will break. That wouldn't be so bad if it werent for the fact that YOU CANNOT DELETE DEBRIS. AND EVERY SINGLE PIECE OF DEBRIS HAS THE POTENTIAL TO FURTHER DAMAGE BLOCKS. You cannot place a block with debris in the way, so you must try to bulldoze the debris out of the way awkwardly with your body, sometimes further damaging your building. Remember the torch tool from Space Engineers? There is NOTHING like that. Let's say you have a column and the above example happened and a bit of debris damages and chips the bottom block of that column. YOU MUST NOW DELETE THE WHOLE COLUMN FROM THE TOP OF THE COLUMN DOWN TO REPAIR THAT ONE BLOCK. developers: PLEASE ADD A WAY TO DELETE ALL DEBRIS. Also, add a tool so that I can repair a damaged block without having the replace the block.ALSO, THIS GAME AND SPACE ENGINEERS IS ULTIMATELY BORING BECAUSE THERE ARE IS NO AI. I can understand with Space Engineers, because it would be too complicated to script AI NPCs to try and navigate and use all the different designs of ships dynamically. BUT now with the medieval setting, you HAVE TO add some villager AI, a way to assign jobs. This game will be boring fast.

content:
Posted: February 24, 2015
Early Access Review
								AVOID THIS GAME (for now)!!! Game looks cool, but it ate my GTX 970 for breakfast. Simply will not play on anything less. My GPU will handle AC: Black Flag, Shadow of Mordor, and other newish games at 2160p with framerates at or around 50-60fps. This game plays in 1080p at 30ish with noticeable stutter, unless destroying objects, in which case the framerate drops into the teens. Bought an extra copy for a friend who plays space engineers, but the game won't even start on his computer (roughly equivalent to, but not on the list of, minimum required graphics). Maybe with some serious improvements Medieval Engineers will become playable. I hope so. And I will change my review if this is ever the case. But for now, I want a refund, and you will too.

number of helpful: 0 of 10 people (0%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: February 24, 2015
Early Access Review
								I would like to start this review by saying that I am biased. I was thinking that this game was the greatest idea ever and tried to like it. It just sucks though. It looks pretty and IS a good idea, but it was made poorly. THIS IS STILL EARLY ACCESS and may improve. I hope that it does. This game has great potential. It is very limited at the moment however. There is no multiplayer at the time of me writing this review, it has bad physics in some aspects, and gives you a very small plot of land for your castle. I want to search for a perfect spot and not just be given a bad one. I don't even want to be GIVEN a good one. I want to search for it. You don't have to gather resources either. It is very hard to use with many complicated controls and poor programming. I honestly think that this game will get much better, but from what I've seen, it is not up to standards yet.

content:
Posted: March 27, 2015
Early Access Review
								If your looking for a review on this game you've come to the wrong place, but if your looking for an outstanding pie recipe you've come to the right place.Ingredients:1. 6 tablespoons unsalted butter2. 1/2 cup white sugar3. 1/2 cup brown sugar4. 1/4 cup water5. 1/4 teaspoon cinnamon6. 1 pinch salt7. 5 apples - peeled, cored and sliced8. 1 pastry for double-crust pie Directions:1. Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).2. Combine butter, white sugar, brown sugar, water, cinnamon, and salt in a saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil, remove from heat and set aside.3. Roll out half the pastry to fit a 9-inch pie plate. Place bottom crust in pie plate; pour in apple slices.4. Roll out top crust into a 10-inch circle. Cut into 8 (1-inch) wide strips with a sharp paring knife or pastry wheel. Weave the pastry strips, one at a time, into a lattice pattern. Fold the ends of the lattice strips under the edge of the bottom crust and crimp to seal.5. Pour butter-sugar mixture over top of pie, coating the lattice, and allowing any remaining sauce to drizzle through the crust.6. Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C), and bake until the crust is golden brown, the caramel on the top crust is set, and the apple filling is bubbling, 35 to 40 more minutes. Allow to cool completely before slicing.

content:
Posted: February 20, 2015
Early Access Review
								This review is based on early accessed version and I'll edit this once I deem fit, blah blah blah.In short: Not now. (Unless you have a lot of money and you don't know how to spend it, then, fo for it).This game looks very promising, and, don't get me wrong, I do like this game (Umm, maybe I'll like later versions). However, there are so many things to remind you that this is not a good choice to spend your $20, for now.Pro:  -The  "Every thing can be destoryed" idea is interesting.  -There should be some other pros, but I forgot them...Con:  -Bugs. Yes, this is in early access. But, hello, for a $20 early access title you won't expect to find bugs every single minute, which I'm not exaggerating. Most of them are just minor glichs which we're already get used to, thanks to Ubi, EA and many others, some of them are serious bugs which will pervent you from building what you want to build, which is the whole point of this game.  -Missing content. Some stuff you can clearly see in trailer can not be found in game (Corner celling and Wall flags, for example). This is not a big problem since I believe the developers will add them in future patchs. But, don't you thing they are a little bit dishonest?Maybe it's just me who have got these problems. Since it's seems everybody else are absolutly love this game. Please correct me if you find the game is fine and the only thing gone wrong is my mind.First, the graphic. I know many people concern this question. But, what would you expect from a medieval building game made by indie developers who are only be known becase the space engineer? No offense, developers, the graphic is fine, and it's actually better than fine, despite I started feeling sick after serval hours working with stones (It's mainly my fault beacuse I'll get the same feeling when mining in Minecraft). However, it is a bit of problem if you want to built an enormous castle using only stone. Their is no "lighting" in this game, I mean, no light emitted from torch or other light sources. So it looks the same no matter how you arrange your torchs, every thing is grey (gray) and ugly when you stand inside your stone building.Second, the physic. Most people want this game because of the fancy "every thing can be destoryed" stuff. However, I wouldn't recommand to take this serious at this stage. Yes, every thing can be destoryed (Or is it? I once found a spot on a bridge was indestructible, no matter how hard I tried to bring it down, until I shot the block next to it). However, you'll need either a extremely powerful computer or a extremely good patience to bring down a giant castle (Tear down a small lavatory is not fun, is it?). Again, it's like a hybrid car, you know it will be the future, you know every of them on the market are rubbish, and, with finger crossed, you wish this time things would be different. But it's just not, hybrids are as rubbish as usual, they are not ready, yet. I know developing physic engine is a really tough job. And, as a programer myself, I think the developers of this game did a relatively good job. However, for the entertaining sake, this game is not ready (Unless slow and weird physic engine entertains you as much as if it's perfect). "What if I just want to knock down some moderate-sized stuff?" Well, if you ask me, I'll say the real in-game experience is not as good as you saw in those trailers. Maybe it's just because the trailers are recorded with some newer versions which are not pulished yet (This explained the missing contents). Or, maybe the developers only showed us the good ones and edited out all bad ones, which is acceptable.Third, misc. Don't buy this game if you're a little bit of a OCD person like me! For example, every block is devided into 4*4(*4) sub-surfaces for you to put smaller item on it, which means you'll never have the chance to put a torch on the enter of a block!!! Ok, this is actually not a big deal. But, hello, I know there are many people in the world will find this annoying just like me XD. Besides these design "defect", some bugs will also annoys you to the end of your life (Or hopefully, to the release of a future update). For example, when trying to build a retractable bridge (Which you can find in almost all cartoons that has a castle) I need two "woodlock" (Or called something else, I forgot it), which is basicly a rotation axis. Either woodlock works fine, but when I connected them together (SIMPLY connect them with a wood stick, nothing else), both locks suddenly decided to not let wood rotation anymore! Be noticed, the "woodlock" here means lock wood to one axis, not lock it completely, I'm sure. Oh, one more thing, aiming your catapult is much harder than sending human to the moon. Please, developers, make aiming easier, or at least, make reloading less painful.

content:
Posted: February 21, 2015
Early Access Review
								At the moment I can not recommend this game since it has a lot of perfomance issues. In the start menu my GPU (GTX 660Ti) peaks at 60% GPU usage (60% GPU usage for a pre-rendered demo???). In loading screen and in game it goes up to 97-100% GPU usage (with every graphics setting on lowest option in game and everything turned off in Nvidia control panel).There is no "view distance" option which might be the core of these problems (since everything in the world seems to be rendered), otherwise it's a fundamental flaw in their code (use of polygonal voxels?) and way of processing.

content:
Posted: February 19, 2015
Early Access Review
								Update 2/23/2015STRONGLY DISCOURAGE PURCHASING THIS GAMEOpened the game to a black screen. Closed. Reopened.What kind of company sells a four pack for a single player game without having the multiplayer implemented? I enjoyed Space Engineers, but I have thoroughly lost respect for both this company, and the early access system. This game is a rip off, do not waste your money unless you sit in your basement alone for hours with no one to talk to and dream of camelot.Update 2/21/2015: 21/89 People (24%) found the review helpful. Why is it so hard for people to point out the flaw in an early access game and not get trolled by fanboys? I was a fan of space engineers, however it suffers the same fatal flaw. It's unfinished. The game can only be played for so long before it becomes methodically boring.Tried playing the game again, the game overloads your graphics card when placing terrain textures because it reloads the grass with every block placed. The game crashes so bad that it requires steam to be restarted.Screen blacks out at EVERY auto save. 10/10 It's a game. As it stands now (Early Access) the game is stunningly beautiful... however almost completely unplayable. In my entire time playing the game I have crashed more than 7 times, had my screen turn completely black at least 4 times, only to save the game and return to the same black screen. Save your money and wait for them to work out the kinks.System Specs: Gigabyte (Nvidia) GTX 760 5GHz AMD 8 Core Processor16 GB RAM

content:
Posted: February 19, 2015
Early Access Review
								^^^Blue box says "Early Access"  Controls are by default ♥♥♥♥♥♥,,  excaktly like Space engineers.To exspensive for a empty sandbox..Building physics simulator  = 8/10Actual Engineering Mechanics  =  2/10So what do you want?  Build buildings and destroy them, or play with the mechanics.As a Civel Energy Engineering student on 5th Semester this is completely unrelated to reality.It's Authentic but not realistic, nice physics, but in comparison to software we usually useto simulate structural integrety etc, like ANSYS this is purely for fun.Even though the trailer somehow put a emphasis on the Mechanics of the game,right now the mechanics are limitet to pulleys, non-elastic wires, and wheels.As of now, I have yet to discover to build a cogqheel, considering I'm not allowedto attach anything onto the wheel, as is, My current cogwheels are just squaresturning around, it works in a very crude fasion, and does not produce a satisfactoryresult.Buildt a few drawbrigdes, windmils, watermill, and lifts but it's very crude.And I'm really missing- Traditional pylleys, for cable gearing, or guiding- ability to produce round wheels, with plugs for rotational gearing- straight pieces with plugs for linear gearing---- however,,,The building (as in houses) aspect of the game is great.But as a Engineer, I'm not really interested in the buildings, only the mechanics.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: February 19, 2015
Early Access Review
								UPDATE:This game is going nowhere, they can't seem to land on a direction, and the constant tiny updates are making sure they don't do anything substantial. OLD REVIEWIn its current state as of May 1st, 2015 the game is not much more then a couple of building blocks and terrain manipulation, as well as downloading other maps and exploring them. This itself is fun for a couple hours, but if you've played creation games you've done this before. The thing that sets this apart currently is the destruction which is immensely satisfying! Buying this in its current state (as of this writing) is for helping the developers and taking their word on this game becoming something greater. I trust them which is why I recommend this, their work on Space Engineers is great and this game has a lot of promise.

content:
Posted: July 25, 2015
Early Access Review
								Wonderful game. It's coming along quite niceley since it's first release. More blocks are added regularly and performance just keeps getting better. If you enjoyed space engineers and are a fan of the medieval time period then you must check this game out. I'd have to say this game is a lot more demanding than SE, a lot harder and there are much more things to take into account. The fact that gravity now plays a role, structures can collapes underneath themselves, and you can't fly.I highly recommend this game if you enjoy survival games, building games, and the emedieval era. You can't go wrong with this one.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: August 20, 2015
Early Access Review
								I have spent 11 hours in this 'game' trying to put together a fairly simple structure.  I've failed, the online guides and simple interface notwithstanding.  At this point my enthusiasm for the idea of building a stone building with a doorway and roof has waned, so I'll go back to Skyrim for a while waiting for the MMI to be improved.  If I could have just one improvement, it would be an UNDO button for invariably what I expected to happen when I attempted something, didn't happen.  Instead I was usually surprised and regretted the move and recovery was usually impossible.  The best hint I can provide is to save after every successful build step, knowing that you'll want to reload from your save when you make your next build mistake.  If I had another improvement, it would be a construction guide that doesn't gloss over simple things like how to lower the terrain so I can place a block where I want it, how to put roof pieces on top of walls to cover a structure, and why I can place a solid stone block in space over a stairwell and it stays, but a wood floor over the same stairwell won't stand.   All in all, a huge disappointment but with the promise of being loads of fun once it works.  The game seems to have two modes, construction and fighting.  I did not attempt the fighting mode, I wasn't interested in that mode.

content:
Posted: April 21, 2015
Early Access Review
								This game definitely doesn't deserve a "No" vote, but at this point it is just too early for me. They have done a great job, so far, but the game really feels pre-alpha, not early access. What I like:Making destructive machines that can launch stuff at great velocity and distanceNear infinite flexibility in construction of said machines ore buildingsAbility to place multiple blocks in one positionWhat I don't like:Dynamic objects (for example a cart) regularly become static by accident while working on them and require pieces to be removed to free them up again.Dying from simply pushing on a dynamic object in survivalSurvival only adds death (for now)Will definitely be keeping an eye on the game's progress and look forward to coming back to more functionallity and polish soon!

content:

Early Access Review
								First and foremost, this game is Early Access. A new update comes out every week, and I couldn't be happier with the dev interaction with the community. I own both Medieval Engineers and Space Engineers and I absolutely love both. While this game may not be as fleshed out as KSH's other title, it has some of the best building you will ever find in a game. If you enjoy building castles, siege weapons, and medieval vehicles this is the game for you. Structural integrity makes building harder, and realistic destruction amazing. 9/10 (Based on Early Access status)

								this game is awesome, but there is some features that i would realy like to be added, and not like a year into the future, but in a month max!    -bigger maps-better survival, that reminds people of the medieval era.-better voxel controls.-better physisks meaning, that i (can) build a giant dynamic structure, without having to cry over all the gliching and spassing it does, physics in this game works, just not for bigger structures, and that annoys me.-more dynamic enviroment, in this game you constantly get reminded that it is just a game, becourse there are too few animal species, too recognizable biome difrence with moore or less no intresting plants or weird stones. look at ARK and you will know my meaning.-UPDATE THE GAME FREQUENTLY PLS, all though you make some of the best games in the world. you still never do the finishing tuch before the game is about to die out, by then people have allready grown tired of it, meaning that it never gets its time of greatness.i'm a big fan of your comunity, a big fan of the games you make, but sometimes i wonder what your comunity is doing when it is time to upgrade/update the games. becourse it takes sooo long with sooo litle content in each update.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: August 6, 2015
Early Access Review
								I really like this game even if it ends up being like  all those other Early Access games. What I mean is this: if it stops updating, I would be disappointed and might even stop playing for a while but I won't abandon it forever. It at least has a lot of stuff in it where I can be creative, and its moddable. In its current condition, it has more than other games I played.1. It runs great on my computer. The only time it lags is when it should lag. When I spawn a giant wall just to watch it fall over, it should lag for me. It's like any other great game out there. What makes me even more happy is that they plan on optimizing it more.2. Its moddable, I can download other creations, and even share mine.3. The trailer alone blew me away. Its one thing to make a game with a destructible environment (ie. Red Faction), another with changeable terrain and building blocks (ie. Minecraft), and another with great graphics (ie. Far Cry). But when I experience something with all 3 combined, then I get overwhelmed with excitement. Now add the ability to make custom siege weapons and all that fun. :)4. It's great when you have multiplayer. That means I can play with friends or at least other people. Now add the ability to start a server yourself with 3 options.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: June 30, 2015
Early Access Review
								REVIEW SUBJECT TO CHANGE:ALPHAPlaying ME in creative mode feels like minecraft in creative mode with the added possibility of everything crashing into rubble.  Lots of cool stuff, the mechanisms and variety of things you can build are cool.  I dont like creative mode however.Survival:  Its in a very early implimenation  however I figured gathering resources and having 2 AI assistants to help with some legwork combined with the general beauty of the game would lend itself to a somewhat nervewracking but overall satifying building experience.  At this current stage of development its... I dont think I can come up with any adjective to describe it.  Survival mode is like playing The Forest but instead of dangerous cannibals the biggest and most dangerous threat is wood chunks.  Dont dare run around them, dont let them pile up... they are a violent and unstable enemy.  Running haphazardly through a pile of wood chunks often causes them to rubberband wildly, breaking the physics and causing them to become flying insta-kill objects.  That can be avoided after careful trial and error and constantly watching your step however another sinister danger lurks.  Everything else.  Trees fall while logging and tumble into  each other sometimes sending one or more flying at an unprectable angle at speeds estimated at roughly 300mph.  Mine in the wrong direction and a rock will tap you and kill you instantly.  In the most extreme case i experienced I went to pick a log off the top of another log and I didnt see what happened however i was thrown cartwheeling through the air and flew off so high that after I respawned I watched my stilll whirling corpse coast over some trees and pinwheel into them knocking a few over.  The AI for the 2 servents you get is utterly appaling.  They will walk into holes and stand staring into the sky.  They will pick up a rock, turn too fast or bump something dropping the rock, and continue to walk to their destinations empty handed, stop at the stockpile, and then turn around to go back.  They will pick up the log that is at the bottom of a pile of logs and try to move it causing them to suffer a similar fate as you would, being crushed or flung into space.  They also only walk.  Very slowly.  From my mine to my stockpile i ran back and forth carrying rocks and transported 6 rocks before they dropped off one.Then the building.... the resources required are quite intensive due to the difficulty in transport.  Thats fine for the most part but the most frustrating thing is the building itself.  I swung the construction hammer roughly 50 times with available ingredients for a wood floor and it didnt even register.  Then it would register one hit, go up from 20% complete to 35% and then *whiff whiff whiff whiff* swinging all over the space just nothing.In short, completely absurd.  Totally unplayable.  If your excited about Survival mode stay far away for now.

content:
Posted: May 3, 2015
Early Access Review
								So decided to take the plunge and buy this game, loved space engineers so why not get this one too right?Well what can I say except it's an early access game, there are the basics which allow you to construct castles, bridges, houses and seige weapons to your hearts content though it still lacks that certain something to make it worth while playing for extended periods of time, that and I keep getting random game crashes.Pro's:- Can build to your hearts content- Can place AI peasants, barbarians, deer so it doesn't feel as empty- Has a free build mode as well as survival mode- Graphics are quite good for this stage of development and the game doesn't lag or stutterCon's:- Could do with more building materials- AI are incredibly thick- Survival mode doesn't feel like a survival mode, just a slightly harder free mode- The game does have that random tendency to crash- The physics need work.... one small block of stone should not destroy a large portion of stone foundation like a bomb had gone off on it!- Only weapon in the game is a club...which is just stupid.Will add more as time goes on, would recommend this as the devs will need your support to shape and polish the game into a finished product.If you buy this excpecting miricles then don't whine about it when those miricles don't become reality, that will only happen in time.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: March 2, 2015
Early Access Review
								Now, Don't mistake this game to be anything like space engineers, The people over at Keen have done an amazing job at making this game vary from space engineers, Those of you who have Space Engineers will have to re-think everything you thought you knew about engineering. The Physics complexity, The Graphical beauty and the absolutely stunning soundtrack make this game completely worth the cost! The soundtrack alone is worth buying this game!The downside's are that the game so far has not been completed, so flaws are to be expected, and the structural integrity can crash the game at some point and because it's newer there's a distinct lack of mod's compared to its space-themed counterpart.To sum it all up;Pro's:+Graphically stunning, very good for an alpha, But atleast on my PC, Not too taxing.+Eargasm! The soundtrack is both soothing, and uplifting. If you like medieval themed orchestra, Then the music alone is reason enough to buy this game!+Complex physics.  Something that is hardly ever seen in most games is the formation of rubble in such a believable manner. Your building's will have to stand up to the test of gravity and it really makes you need to think outside the box!+Scroll n' roll. Scrolling with select blocks will give you varients of that block type. This is something i love about Medieval Engineers. Nuff said.+Blockception. You can place a block withing a block withing a block within a bl- (etc.)Con's:-Physics! Y U DO THIS?! Like I said, Amazingly complex and glorious physics and destruction, But these attributes are also a downfall if you build too big! The very structural integrity this game is heralded for is its greatest downfall, requiring you to bear with the limitations of the current engine. Remember, This will probably be changed in later updates.-So, No real weapons? Well, Not yet. You can shoot canonballs but let's be honest. We're all waiting for swords, shields, bows and arrows! The recent addition of Barbarians (destructive A.I.) can't be killed very easily and appear to have their own spiked club as a weapon, which is not available to the player at this time. This will mostlikely change in future updates.Now there are probably some other things, but that's a summary. Also, some blocks are missing from the trailer, My guess is over at Keen, They are fixing up some block dynamics, Checking viability and tweaking the physics engine a bit. The lack of mod's in the steam workshop should be temporary too, as the more people get this, the more modder's will come and grace this gem of a game. You dont even need to own this game to mod it! :DIn the end, I give it a 9.5/10. Good job Keen and thanks for this wonderful addition to my Steam library!

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: March 2, 2015
Early Access Review
								This game has its good points and bad points.It does run on Win8.1 64bit, 8GB RAM, AMD 6 core processor at 3.20GHz, Radeon HD 5670 card but I had to turn down my graphics to the lowest settings to remove all lag.Good is that Its a Medieval sandbox builders game, the graphics are awesome, has flymode, background music is great.Bad points is that loading each level takes awhile to complete & changing settings while in-game takes awhile to complete too, cannot remove trees easily and debris, building floors are difficult, not a lot of building materials to choose from, removing parts of the ground and rebuilding it back up is terrible, in-game sounds needs work, game controls needs work.I know a lot of these problems will be fixed as new updates rolls out but I don't know when. I do recommend buying this game but not right now. Wait a few more months.

content:
Posted: March 1, 2015
Early Access Review
								I've played about 8 hours so far. Here's some things I've noticed-A castle made out of wood is 10 times stronger than a castle made out of stone-when you build a castle make sure you dont connect your walls to your castle, when the walls are destroyed it will activate a domino effect which stupidly destroys your castle-If you insist on building a stone castle, be sure to put down as many wooden floors and wooden beams as possilbleBasically, stone is very very weak, a light gust of wind could make it violently explodeIf you feel like "investing" into this game then go ahead, be remember this is a investment not a game purchase.You're investing in what this game could be, not what it is at the momment. I'm hoping this turns out to be what Castle Story was suppose to be

								So decided to take the plunge and buy this game, loved space engineers so why not get this one too right?Well what can I say except it's an early access game, there are the basics which allow you to construct castles, bridges, houses and seige weapons to your hearts content though it still lacks that certain something to make it worth while playing for extended periods of time, that and I keep getting random game crashes.Pro's:- Can build to your hearts content- Can place AI peasants, barbarians, deer so it doesn't feel as empty- Has a free build mode as well as survival mode- Graphics are quite good for this stage of development and the game doesn't lag or stutterCon's:- Could do with more building materials- AI are incredibly thick- Survival mode doesn't feel like a survival mode, just a slightly harder free mode- The game does have that random tendency to crash- The physics need work.... one small block of stone should not destroy a large portion of stone foundation like a bomb had gone off on it!- Only weapon in the game is a club...which is just stupid.Will add more as time goes on, would recommend this as the devs will need your support to shape and polish the game into a finished product.If you buy this excpecting miricles then don't whine about it when those miricles don't become reality, that will only happen in time.

								Lots of potential to be as fun as Space Engineers but with gravity! I am hoping that this game will be easier to co-operate in.But like everyone else I have my own crossover idea for this game and it's predecessor: the Space Engineers can enter orbit and harvest the material from the planet. The guys on the ground would try and protect their resources while being under assault from futuristic machines.

Early Access Review
								 I bought this game when it was available for Early-Early Access for 24 hours, and it was worth it! To see all of the brilliant physics of this game, and the beautiful landscape, and hear the awesome music, it all blew my mind!! I highly recommend this game to anyone who loves realistic physics, awesome graphics, and who loves to be constructive and destructive! Thank you Keen Software House for developing one heck of a cool game, your engineering titles have loads of potential in the gaming industry!!

Posted: February 27, 2015
Early Access Review
								this game is probely the best voxel based, physics sandbox i have seen and played, the game is in Early Access so you can't expect lots out of it bearing in mind that it came out a few days ago.the minimum requirements it says that you need at least 1024MB of VRAM(Video memory) and i have 312MB, setting it at the right settings and i get 15-20 FPS and thats on a laptop, this game can run on laptops to big rigs completly fine.i love the physics, especially when you need to build beams to have a second floor under that floor.it has some good motors and pulleys and gears.You need to have a creative mind to play this for  long time (Nerd3) and its alot of funi rate this 9.5/10 because nothing is perfect and there is room to expand on.this game has alot of potential and is great !!!!  :)
